entry.title: Squamish 2025
entry.content:
Back to Squamish! Not only do I love the granite, but also the food, weather, and general amenities.

Jack styling the Burglar and the Reacharound, respectively.

Traversing up the Hairpin left em cheesin!

Jack enjoying the scenic backdrop!

Time for donuts!

Throne of Moss

Unknown climber on Apron Strings.

Jack dancing back and forth up the perfect finger crack of the Exasperator.

The final reach!

Bring your bike to crag day üòµ‚Äçüí´

"Wait, am I going right?" Slap and Tickle.

"I have to lunge for THAT?!?"

The Grand Wall!

Bracing for the heat at the top of Slot Machine and Ma√±ana.

Final jog up Bullethead East before swim time.

Turns out biking in Squamish is kind of sandbagged!
entry.summary: A couple long weekends in Squamish, BC

entry.title: Yosemite Valley 2025
entry.content:
This spring I got to take my first climbing trip to Yosemite Valley. Over a couple weeks I got to climb many classic routes including Ma√±ana, Astroman, Royal Arches, Serenity-Sons, Freeblast, and Lurking Fear. Overall, the Valley met my expectations: Starbucks, crowds, and beginner climbers alongside the highest concentration of quality granite rock climbs and crusher rock climbers I‚Äôve ever seen.

El Capitan ‚Äî can you spot the parties climbing the wall? There are at least 4!

Astroman! THE free climb of the Valley. We got absolutely wrecked by the infamous Harding Slot, but had so much fun.

Biking past 2,000 ft waterfalls on our way to 2,000 ft rock climbs??? What a treat!

Jack Taylor on the Royal Arches.

Jack, soaking it in!

The ditch! As seen from the prow of WA Column.

WA Column, Half Dome, the splitter cracks of Serenity-Sons, and (finally) a rest day!

Me working up the first pitch of the Freeblast!
Jack on pitch 4 and me on Heart Ledge. What an awesome route! I did not quite onsight but had a "blast"!

Looking back up at Heart Ledges. ü©∂

Lurking Fear! My first ever big wall climb. Everyone asks about sleeping on the ledge, but that was no problem after the real challenge: hauling the pigs!

Day 2 on Lurking fear.

Our final bivvy and top out! A magical time with a great friend.
entry.summary: 10 days of climbing in Yosemite, CA

entry.title: Alpine Rafting
entry.content:
Nothing is better than floating in an alpine lake!

You can see right to the bottom, which sort of makes it feel like if you fall out of the boat, you‚Äôre gonna fall 100 feet!

entry.title: The Incredible Hulk 2024
entry.content:
Climbing at the Hulk with one of my best friends, Brett. We learned that the main face of the Hulk is very windy, and that it doesn‚Äôt really make sense to go up there for a whole week when you can easily do day trips while climbing in Tuolumne, Bishop, or elsewhere in the Sierra. Even so, we had an awesome time ‚Äî¬†good rock, great hangs, and lots of laughs!

The Hulk!
  The view from our campsite.
 
Brett cruising up the splitter cracks of the Polish Route.
A Sierra oasis.
  Brett approaching the first crux of Positive Vibrations.
What a beautiful piece of rock!

After pretending to boulder on a rest day (left), we were chased over to Tuolumne by thunderstorms (right)! A great end to a great trip.
entry.summary: 7 days of climbing at the Hulk, CA
